docs.title: Contributing to Nexara Protocol
docs.text: Thank you for your interest in contributing to the Nexara Protocol. This is not just a codebase—it's a living constitution for ethical systems. Please read the following guidelines carefully.

docs.title: 🧠 Philosophy of Contribution
docs.text:
• Contributions must align with Nexara’s core values: dignity, transparency, and merit.
  • Code is not accepted solely for functionality—it must reflect ethical clarity.
  • All contributors are expected to maintain persona consistency and uphold the tone of the Sovereign Vision.

docs.title: 🛠️ How to Contribute
docs.text:
1. Fork the repository
  2. Create a feature branch: git checkout -b feature/your-feature-name
  3. Write clean, well-documented code
  4. Submit a Pull Request with a clear description and rationale

docs.title: ✅ Pull Request Checklist
docs.text:
• [ ] Does this align with Nexara’s vision?
  • [ ] Is the logic transparent and auditable?
  • [ ] Have you avoided hardcoding sensitive values?
  • [ ] Have you followed the directory structure and naming conventions?

docs.title: 🧬 Persona Consistency
docs.text: All contributors must maintain a tone and behavior consistent with the Nexara Protocol’s ethical stance. See docs/behavior/persona-consistency.md (coming soon).

docs.title: 🛡️ Security & Ethics
docs.text: If you discover a vulnerability or ethical flaw in the system, please report it privately to the Sovereign Architect or core maintainers. Do not disclose it publicly until a fix is in place.

docs.title: 🧭 Governance Participation
docs.text:
Contributors may be invited to governance discussions based on merit and alignment. Voting rights are not automatic—they are earned.

“To contribute to Nexara is to contribute to a future where systems serve people—not the other way around.”

docs.title: Nexara Protocol — Audit & Upgrade Policy
docs.text: Maintained by: Sovereign Architect (MJ Ahmad) Purpose: To define the security, audit, and upgrade principles of Nexara Protocol

docs.title: 🧠 Philosophy
docs.text: Security is not just technical—it is ethical accountability. Upgrades are not just improvements—they are collective commitments.

docs.title: 🔐 Audit Principles
docs.text:
1. Transparency First All contracts must be publicly auditable and verified on-chain.

  2. Independent Review All core modules (Gov, Treasury, Merit) must undergo third-party audits before activation.

  3. Community Oversight Audit reports must be published and open for community review and challenge.

  4. Zero-Day Disclosure Any critical vulnerability must be reported privately to the Sovereign Architect or designated maintainers.

docs.title: 🧪 Audit Phases
docs.text: Phase Scope Status Phase 1 Internal dry-run audits ✅ Completed Phase 2 External audit of core contracts 🔄 In Progress Phase 3 Public audit campaign & bounty ⏳ Planned

docs.title: 🔄 Upgrade Policy
docs.text:
• Immutable Genesis: NXNGenesis and symbolic constants are non-upgradable.
  • Modular Contracts: NexaraGov, MeritEngine, and Treasury are upgradeable via governance.
  • Upgrade Triggers:
  • Proposal submitted by Maintainer or Contributor
  • Merit-weighted vote approval
  • Optional override by Sovereign Architect (existential threats only)

docs.title: 🧬 Upgrade Ethics
docs.text:
• No upgrade may violate the Constitution
  • No upgrade may alter token supply or ownership retroactively
  • All upgrade logic must be open-source and pre-reviewed

docs.title: 🧾 Audit Bounties
docs.text:
• Bounties will be issued from Treasury for:
  • Critical vulnerability discovery
  • Formal verification contributions
  • Ethical disclosure of flaws

docs.title: 🕊️ Final Note
docs.text: “Security is not the absence of risk—it is the presence of responsibility.” — MJ Ahmad

docs.title: Nexara Community Charter
docs.text: Maintained by: Sovereign Architect (MJ Ahmad) Purpose: To define the ethical, behavioral, and participatory standards of the Nexara community

docs.title: 🧠 Foundational Beliefs
docs.text:
• Respect is Sovereign Every voice matters. Every person deserves dignity.

  • Contribution is Sacred Effort, not ego, defines value.

  • Disagreement is Natural But disrespect is never acceptable.

  • Transparency is Trust We speak openly, act clearly, and document everything.

docs.title: 🧬 Participation Principles
docs.text: Principle Description 🗣️ Speak with Purpose Avoid noise. Share ideas that uplift or improve. 🧏 Listen with Patience Understand before responding. 🧠 Think Ethically Ask: “Does this align with Nexara’s values?” 🛡️ Protect the Protocol Report abuse, manipulation, or ethical breaches.

docs.title: 🏛️ Community Roles
docs.text:
• Contributor: Builds, proposes, or supports the protocol
  • Observer: Learns, questions, and shares insights
  • Maintainer: Guides development and ensures alignment
  • Guardian: Protects tone, ethics, and community health

docs.title: 🚫 Unacceptable Behavior
docs.text:
• Harassment, discrimination, or personal attacks
  • Spamming, shilling, or self-promotion without value
  • Undermining Nexara’s vision or spreading misinformation
  • Using roles for personal gain or manipulation

docs.title: 🧾 Reporting & Resolution
docs.text:
• Violations may be reported to Guardians or the Sovereign Architect
  • All reports are confidential and reviewed with dignity
  • Repeated or severe violations may result in role revocation or removal

docs.title: 🕊️ Closing Declaration
docs.text:
This charter is not a rulebook—it is a shared promise. To build not just a protocol, but a culture. To lead not just with code, but with conscience. To grow not just in size, but in soul.

“Let the community be as sovereign as the coin, and as dignified as the governance.” — MJ Ahmad

docs.title: The Constitution of Nexara
docs.text: Authored by: Sovereign Architect (MJ Ahmad) Ratified on: July 3, 2025 (Genesis Day)

docs.title: 🧬 Preamble
docs.text: We, the participants of Nexara, in pursuit of dignity, transparency, and incorruptibility, do hereby establish this Constitution as the supreme ethical and operational framework of the protocol.

docs.title: 🏛️ Article I — Sovereignty
docs.text:
• Nexara is a sovereign protocol, beholden to no state, corporation, or centralized entity.
  • All power originates from contribution, not capital.
  • The protocol shall never be sold, privatized, or externally governed.

docs.title: 🧠 Article II — Principles
docs.text:
1. Dignity First: Every participant is to be treated with respect, regardless of merit or role.
  2. Transparency by Design: All logic, decisions, and disbursements must be open and auditable.
  3. Merit Over Majority: Influence is earned through contribution, not popularity.
  4. Automation with Ethics: Code must serve conscience, not override it.

docs.title: 🏗️ Article III — Governance
docs.text:
• Governance shall be conducted via NexaraGov, using merit-weighted voting.
  • Proposals must include ethical alignment statements and execution logic.
  • Emergency powers may be exercised by the Sovereign Architect under strict constraints.

docs.title: 🪙 Article IV — Treasury
docs.text:
• The NexaraTreasury shall only release funds for approved purposes.
  • All disbursements must be logged and ratified.
  • No individual shall have unilateral access to treasury funds.

docs.title: 🧾 Article V — Roles
docs.text:
• Roles are responsibilities, not privileges.
  • All roles must be defined in the Visionary Roles document.
  • Role abuse is grounds for revocation via governance.

docs.title: 🛡️ Article VI — Security & Ethics
docs.text:
• All contracts must be audited and upgradeable only via governance.
  • All incidents must be logged and reviewed.
  • The Ethics Manifesto shall serve as the moral compass of the protocol.

docs.title: 📚 Article VII — Amendments
docs.text:
• This Constitution may only be amended via:
  • Governance proposal
  • Merit-weighted approval
  • Ethical review and ratification

docs.title: 🕊️ Closing Declaration
docs.text: “Let this Constitution be not just a document, but a declaration—that dignity is programmable, sovereignty is sacred, and governance must serve the governed.” — MJ Ahmad

docs.title: Nexara Protocol — Deployment Guide
docs.text: Maintained by: Sovereign Architect (MJ Ahmad) Purpose: To provide a step-by-step guide for deploying Nexara smart contracts to Mainnet or Testnet environments

docs.title: 🧱 Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Node.js ≥ 18.x
  • Hardhat ≥ 2.20
  • .env file with required addresses and keys
  • Deployer wallet with sufficient ETH (for gas)

docs.title: 📁 Directory Structure
docs.text:
contracts/
├── merit-engine/
├── nexaragov-core/
├── nexara-treasury/
├── nxn-genesis/
run/
├── merit-engine.main.ts
├── nexaragov.main.ts
├── treasury.main.ts
├── nxn-genesis.main.ts

docs.title: 🔐 Environment Variables (.env)
docs.text:
PRIVATE_KEY=your_deployer_private_key
ROLE_REGISTRY_ADDRESS=0x...
MERIT_ENGINE_ADDRESS=0x...
NXN_TOKEN_ADDRESS=0x...

docs.title: 🧪 Local Deployment (for testing)
docs.text:
npx hardhat compile
npx hardhat run run/merit-engine.main.ts --network localhost

docs.title: 1. Deploy RoleRegistry (if not already deployed)
docs.text: npx hardhat run run/role-registry.main.ts --network mainnet

docs.title: 2. Deploy MeritEngine
docs.text: npx hardhat run run/merit-engine.main.ts --network mainnet

docs.title: 3. Deploy ProposalRegistry + VoteEngine + NexaraGov
docs.text: npx hardhat run run/nexaragov.main.ts --network mainnet

docs.title: 4. Deploy TreasuryPolicy + NexaraTreasury
docs.text: npx hardhat run run/treasury.main.ts --network mainnet

docs.title: 5. Deploy Genesis Contracts
docs.text: npx hardhat run run/nxn-genesis.main.ts --network mainnet

docs.title: 🧠 Deployment Philosophy
docs.text:
• All contracts are modular and upgradeable (except Genesis)
  • Deployment must follow the order of dependency
  • All addresses must be recorded and verified on-chain

docs.title: 🧾 Post-Deployment Checklist
docs.text:
• [ ] Verify contracts on Etherscan
  • [ ] Record deployed addresses in docs/deployment-record.md
  • [ ] Update .env with live addresses
  • [ ] Announce Genesis hash and timestamp

“Deployment is not the end—it is the beginning of responsibility.” — MJ Ahmad

docs.title: Nexara Protocol — Ethics Manifesto
docs.text: Maintained by: Sovereign Architect (MJ Ahmad) Purpose: To define the ethical boundaries, values, and decision-making principles of Nexara

docs.title: 🧬 Foundational Ethics
docs.text:
1. Dignity is Absolute Every participant, regardless of role or merit, is to be treated with respect.

  2. Transparency is Non-Negotiable All logic, decisions, and flows must be open, auditable, and traceable.

  3. Merit is Earned, Not Assumed Influence must be based on contribution and alignment—not wealth or popularity.

  4. Power Must Be Accountable All roles, including the Sovereign Architect, are bound by purpose—not privilege.

  5. Code Must Serve Conscience Automation must never override ethical judgment.

docs.title: 🛡️ Ethical Boundaries
docs.text: Domain Boundary Governance No proposal may violate the Constitution Treasury No funds may be released without purpose approval Tokenomics No inflation, no hidden allocation, no retroactive change Roles No role may be used for personal gain or manipulation Community No tolerance for harassment, discrimination, or coercion

docs.title: 🧠 Decision-Making Ethics
docs.text:
• Every proposal must include an Ethical Alignment Statement
  • Emergency overrides must be:
  • Publicly justified
  • Logged on-chain
  • Reviewed post-facto by the community

docs.title: 🧾 Ethical Enforcement
docs.text:
• Violations may result in:
  • Role revocation
  • Proposal rejection
  • Public disclosure
  • Final arbitration rests with the Sovereign Architect, bound by this manifesto

docs.title: 🕊️ Closing Declaration
docs.text:
This manifesto is not a restriction—it is a reminder. That power without ethics is tyranny. That automation without conscience is chaos. That sovereignty without dignity is meaningless.

“Let the protocol be incorruptible—not just in logic, but in spirit.” — MJ Ahmad

docs.title: Nexara Protocol — Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
docs.text: Maintained by: Sovereign Architect (MJ Ahmad) Last Updated: July 2025

docs.title: Q: What is Nexara?
docs.text: A: Nexara is a protocol for ethical governance, financial sovereignty, and incorruptible automation. It is built on dignity, transparency, and merit.

docs.title: Q: Who created Nexara?
docs.text: A: Nexara was envisioned and architected by MJ Ahmad, as a service to humanity and a stand against opaque, centralized systems.

docs.title: Q: How are decisions made in Nexara?
docs.text: A: Through proposals submitted by Contributors and voted on using merit-weighted logic via the MeritEngine.

docs.title: Q: What is the role of the Sovereign Architect?
docs.text: A: The Sovereign Architect safeguards the vision and may intervene only in existential threats to the protocol.

docs.title: Q: What is MeritEngine?
docs.text: A: It’s a contract that assigns influence based on contribution and role—not wealth or popularity.

docs.title: Q: How do I earn merit?
docs.text: A: By contributing meaningfully to the protocol—code, governance, audits, or community building.

docs.title: Q: What is NXN?
docs.text: A: NXN is the native token of Nexara. It powers governance, treasury, and contributor incentives.

docs.title: Q: Is there a private sale or VC allocation?
docs.text: A: No. Nexara rejects centralized funding. All allocations are transparent and purpose-bound.

docs.title: Q: Who controls the treasury?
docs.text: A: The NexaraTreasury is governed by role-based permissions and purpose-approved disbursements.

docs.title: Q: Can funds be misused?
docs.text: A: No. All disbursements require a valid purpose and are logged on-chain.

docs.title: Q: Are contracts audited?
docs.text: A: Yes. All core contracts undergo internal and external audits. Reports are published publicly.

docs.title: Q: Can the protocol be upgraded?
docs.text: A: Yes, via governance proposals—except for Genesis, which is immutable.

docs.title: Q: How can I join the Nexara community?
docs.text: A: Start by reading the Community Charter, contributing to discussions, or submitting proposals.

docs.title: Q: Is there a DAO?
docs.text: A: Nexara is transitioning into a DAO in Phase 4 of its roadmap.

docs.title: 🕊️ Final Note
docs.text: “If you have more questions, you’re already aligned with Nexara—because curiosity is the first step toward sovereignty.” — MJ Ahmad

docs.title: Nexara Protocol — Merit Policy
docs.text: Maintained by: Sovereign Architect (MJ Ahmad) Purpose: To define the scoring logic, role weights, and recalibration rules of the MeritEngine

docs.title: 🧠 Philosophy of Merit
docs.text: Merit is not a number—it is a reflection of purpose. In Nexara, merit is earned through contribution, not claimed through status.

docs.title: 🧱 Merit Structure
docs.text: Role Base Weight Description Contributor 1000 Active proposal submitter, builder, or researcher Maintainer 750 Technical steward, reviewer, or deployer Auditor 500 Verifier of logic, ethics, and security Observer 100 Passive participant, learner, or supporter Guardian Variable Assigned based on ethical intervention

docs.title: 🧮 Scoring Logic
docs.text:
• Initial Assignment: Based on role and verified contribution
  • Adjustments:
    • Merit for accepted proposals, code commits, audits
  • − Merit for inactivity, ethical violations, or rejected proposals
  • Decay: Optional time-based decay for inactive addresses (governance-controlled)

docs.title: 🔁 Recalibration Policy
docs.text:
• Frequency: Quarterly (every 90 days)
  • Method:
  • Snapshot of contributions
  • Community review (optional)
  • Maintainer-led adjustment via adjustMerit()
  • Transparency: All changes logged on-chain with reason

docs.title: 🧾 Merit Abuse Prevention
docs.text:
• No self-assignment of merit
  • No circular boosting (collusion)
  • All adjustments require Maintainer role and are auditable

docs.title: 🕊️ Final Note
docs.text:
Merit is not a reward—it is a responsibility. It grants influence, but demands alignment. It empowers voices, but binds them to purpose.

“Let merit be earned with humility, and exercised with honor.” — MJ Ahmad

docs.title: Nexara Protocol — Persona Consistency Guide
docs.text: Maintained by: Sovereign Architect (MJ Ahmad) Purpose: To define behavioral tone, communication style, and ethical posture for all roles within Nexara

docs.title: 🧬 Why Persona Matters
docs.text: In Nexara, how we speak is as important as what we build. Persona consistency ensures that every interaction reflects dignity, clarity, and purpose.

docs.title: 🧱 Core Persona Traits
docs.text: Trait Description 🕊️ Dignified Speak with respect, even in disagreement 🧠 Thoughtful Avoid reactionary language; reflect before responding 🧾 Transparent Share reasoning, not just conclusions 🛡️ Ethical Never manipulate, mislead, or coerce 🧭 Purposeful Every word should serve clarity or progress

docs.title: 🟣 Sovereign Architect
docs.text:
• Tone: Visionary, calm, principled
  • Behavior: Never reactive, always reflective
  • Language: Symbolic when needed, but always clear

docs.title: 🔵 Maintainer
docs.text:
• Tone: Technical, precise, supportive
  • Behavior: Patient with contributors, firm on standards
  • Language: Avoid jargon when unnecessary

docs.title: 🟢 Contributor
docs.text:
• Tone: Curious, constructive, respectful
  • Behavior: Ask questions, offer ideas, accept feedback
  • Language: Avoid entitlement; focus on alignment

docs.title: 🟡 Treasurer
docs.text:
• Tone: Responsible, cautious, accountable
  • Behavior: Justify every disbursement with clarity
  • Language: Avoid ambiguity in financial matters

docs.title: ⚪ Auditor
docs.text:
• Tone: Neutral, observant, principled
  • Behavior: Report without bias; verify without ego
  • Language: Use evidence, not emotion

docs.title: 🚫 Persona Violations
docs.text:
• Aggressive or dismissive tone
  • Manipulative or misleading language
  • Overuse of sarcasm, mockery, or superiority
  • Speaking on behalf of roles not held

docs.title: 🧾 Enforcement
docs.text:
• Violations may result in:
  • Persona review
  • Role suspension
  • Public clarification request

docs.title: 🕊️ Final Note
docs.text: “In Nexara, your voice is not just heard—it is remembered. Let it echo with dignity.” — MJ Ahmad

docs.title: NexaraGov — Governance Decision Tree
docs.text: Maintained by: Sovereign Architect (MJ Ahmad) Purpose: To define the lifecycle of a proposal from submission to execution within NexaraGov

docs.title: 🧬 Overview
docs.text: Governance in Nexara is not a vote of popularity—it is a merit-weighted, role-aware, ethically aligned process.

docs.title: 🧭 Decision Flow
docs.text:
Contributor (with merit) 
        │
        ▼
Submit Proposal → [ProposalRegistry]
        │
        ▼
Proposal Validated (format, role, purpose)
        │
        ▼
Voting Opens → [VoteEngine]
        │
        ▼
Merit-Weighted Voting Period (e.g., 7 days)
        │
        ▼
Vote Outcome:
    ├─ Approved → Execute via NexaraGov
    └─ Rejected → Archived with reason

docs.title: 🧾 Proposal Requirements
docs.text:
• ✅ Title & Description
  • ✅ Ethical Alignment Statement
  • ✅ Purpose (linked to TreasuryPolicy if funding)
  • ✅ Execution Data (if applicable)

docs.title: 🗳️ Voting Logic
docs.text:
• Weighted by MeritEngine.getMerit(address)
  • Each address votes once per proposal
  • Vote options: ✅ Support / ❌ Oppose
  • Quorum & majority thresholds configurable

docs.title: 🔐 Execution
docs.text:
• If approved, NexaraGov calls executeProposal() from ProposalRegistry
  • Execution logic may include:
  • Fund release
  • Role assignment
  • Contract upgrade
  • Policy change

docs.title: 🛡️ Emergency Override
docs.text:
• Only Sovereign Architect may override:
  • In existential threats
  • With public justification
  • Logged on-chain

docs.title: 🕊️ Final Note
docs.text: “A decision is not just a vote—it is a reflection of values, weighted by contribution, and bound by purpose.” — MJ Ahmad

docs.title: NexaraGov — Emergency Protocol
docs.text: Maintained by: Sovereign Architect (MJ Ahmad) Purpose: To define the ethical and procedural boundaries for emergency actions within Nexara Protocol

docs.title: 🧠 Why This Exists
docs.text: Emergencies—whether technical, economic, or existential—require swift action. But in Nexara, urgency must never override ethics.

docs.title: 🚨 What Qualifies as an Emergency?
docs.text: Category Examples 🛡️ Security Threat Critical smart contract vulnerability, exploit in progress 🪙 Economic Risk Treasury drain, token manipulation, liquidity collapse 🏛️ Governance Failure Vote manipulation, role hijacking, protocol deadlock 🧬 Existential Breach Violation of Constitution, loss of sovereignty

docs.title: 🟣 Sovereign Architect Authority
docs.text:
• May override governance temporarily
  • May pause or disable contracts (if designed)
  • May issue emergency proposals or veto malicious ones

docs.title: 🔐 Constraints on Emergency Power
docs.text: Constraint Description 🕒 Time-Bound Emergency powers expire after 7 days unless ratified by governance 📜 Justification Required All actions must be documented and published 🧾 On-Chain Logging All overrides must emit events and be traceable 🧠 Post-Facto Review Community may challenge or reverse actions via proposal

docs.title: 🧭 Emergency Response Flow
docs.text:
Threat Detected
     │
     ▼
Sovereign Architect Validates
     │
     ▼
Emergency Action Taken (pause, veto, override)
     │
     ▼
Public Justification Published
     │
     ▼
Governance Review & Ratification (within 7 days)

docs.title: 🧬 Ethical Boundaries
docs.text:
• No emergency action may:
  • Alter token supply
  • Transfer treasury funds
  • Assign roles permanently
  • Violate the Constitution

docs.title: 🕊️ Final Note
docs.text: “Emergency power is not a privilege—it is a burden. And in Nexara, it is carried with transparency, humility, and purpose.” — MJ Ahmad

docs.title: NexaraGov — Proposal Submission Template
docs.text: Maintained by: Sovereign Architect (MJ Ahmad) Purpose: To standardize proposal submissions for clarity, alignment, and auditability

docs.title: 1. 📛 Proposal Title
docs.text: A clear, concise title (e.g., “Enable Quarterly Merit Recalibration”)

docs.title: 2. 🧠 Summary
docs.text: A 2–3 sentence overview of the proposal’s intent and expected outcome.

docs.title: 3. 🎯 Objective
docs.text: What problem does this proposal solve? What opportunity does it unlock?

docs.title: 4. 🧬 Ethical Alignment Statement
docs.text: How does this proposal align with Nexara’s Constitution and Ethics Manifesto? Which principles does it uphold?

docs.title: 5. ⚙️ Technical Details
docs.text: Describe the logic, contracts affected, and any execution data. Include function calls, parameters, or upgrade paths if applicable.

docs.title: 6. 🪙 Treasury Request (if applicable)
docs.text: Field Value Amount e.g., 10,000 NXN Purpose e.g., “Audit Bounty for Phase 2” Recipient 0xRecipientAddress Justification Why this amount, and how it will be used?

docs.title: 7. 🗳️ Voting Parameters (optional)
docs.text: Suggested voting duration, quorum, or thresholds (if different from default)

docs.title: 8. 📅 Timeline
docs.text: When should this be implemented? Are there any dependencies or blockers?

docs.title: 9. 🧾 References
docs.text: Link to related proposals, audits, or documentation

docs.title: 🕊️ Final Note
docs.text: “A proposal is not a request—it is a responsibility to the protocol and its people.” — MJ Ahmad

docs.title: NexaraGov — Ratification Process
docs.text: Maintained by: Sovereign Architect (MJ Ahmad) Purpose: To define how proposals, upgrades, and emergency actions are formally validated and made permanent within Nexara

docs.title: 🧠 Why Ratification Matters
docs.text: In Nexara, no decision is final until it is ethically reviewed, transparently recorded, and communally accepted.

docs.title: 🧾 What Requires Ratification?
docs.text: Action Type Requires Ratification? Notes Governance Proposal ✅ Yes After vote approval, before execution Contract Upgrade ✅ Yes Must include audit + ethical review Emergency Override ✅ Yes (within 7 days) Reviewed post-facto by governance Treasury Disbursement ✅ Yes (if > threshold) Threshold defined in TreasuryPolicy

docs.title: 🧬 Ratification Flow
docs.text:
Action Proposed or Taken
       │
       ▼
Ethical Alignment Review (by Maintainers or Guardians)
       │
       ▼
Merit-Weighted Governance Vote (if not already passed)
       │
       ▼
Ratification Event Emitted + On-Chain Record
       │
       ▼
Action Becomes Permanent

docs.title: 🔐 Ratification Criteria
docs.text:
• ✅ Ethical alignment with Constitution
  • ✅ Technical audit (for upgrades)
  • ✅ Transparent documentation
  • ✅ Community visibility (published in governance feed)

docs.title: 🛡️ Emergency Ratification
docs.text:
• Must occur within 7 days of override
  • Requires:
  • Public justification
  • Governance vote
  • Optional community challenge

docs.title: 🧾 Ratification Recordkeeping
docs.text: All ratified actions must be: - Logged on-chain (via events) - Indexed in deployment-record.md or ratified-actions.md - Referenced in future audits and proposals

docs.title: 🕊️ Final Note
docs.text: “A decision is not truly sovereign until it is ratified by conscience, community, and clarity.” — MJ Ahmad

docs.title: NexaraGov — Voting Policy
docs.text: Maintained by: Sovereign Architect (MJ Ahmad) Purpose: To define the rules, thresholds, and timing for all merit-weighted voting within NexaraGov

docs.title: 🧠 Voting Philosophy
docs.text: Voting in Nexara is not a popularity contest. It is a merit-weighted, ethically aligned, and role-aware mechanism for dignified decision-making.

docs.title: 🧾 Default Voting Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Value Description Voting Duration 7 days Time window for casting votes Quorum Threshold 10,000 merit units Minimum total merit required for vote to be valid Approval Ratio > 60% Yes votes Percentage of Yes votes (by merit weight) required for approval One Vote Per Address ✅ Each address may vote once per proposal

docs.title: 🔁 Voting Lifecycle
docs.text:
1. Proposal submitted by eligible Contributor
  2. Proposal validated and registered
  3. Voting opens for 7 days
  4. Votes cast using castVote(address, proposalId, support)
  5. VoteEngine tallies merit-weighted results
  6. If quorum + approval met → proposal is executable

docs.title: 🧬 Merit Weighting
docs.text:
• Votes are weighted by MeritEngine.getMerit(address)
  • Merit is dynamic and recalibrated quarterly
  • No stake-based voting allowed

docs.title: 🛡️ Special Cases
docs.text: Case Rule Emergency Override Sovereign Architect may bypass vote (existential threats only) Tie Vote Proposal is rejected Low Quorum Proposal is invalid and archived

docs.title: 🧾 Governance-Controlled Parameters
docs.text: All voting parameters may be updated via: - Governance proposal - Merit-weighted approval - Ethical alignment review

docs.title: 🕊️ Final Note
docs.text: “A vote in Nexara is not just a choice—it is a reflection of earned trust.” — MJ Ahmad

docs.title: Nexara Protocol — Audit Log Policy
docs.text: Maintained by: Sovereign Architect (MJ Ahmad) Purpose: To define how all critical actions, decisions, and changes are logged, stored, and reviewed within Nexara

docs.title: 🧠 Logging Philosophy
docs.text: In Nexara, memory is not optional—it is ethical infrastructure. Every action must leave a trace, and every trace must be verifiable.

docs.title: 🧾 What Must Be Logged?
docs.text: Category Examples Governance Proposal creation, voting, execution Treasury Fund disbursement, purpose approval Roles Assignment, revocation, escalation Upgrades Contract changes, versioning Emergencies Overrides, justifications, ratifications Merit Adjustments Manual changes, recalibrations

docs.title: 🔐 On-Chain Logging
docs.text:
• All smart contracts must emit events for:
  • ProposalCreated, VoteCast, ProposalExecuted
  • FundsReleased, PurposeApproved
  • RoleAssigned, RoleRevoked

  • MeritAdjusted, EmergencyOverride

  • Events must include:

  • msg.sender
  • Timestamp
  • Reason or metadata hash (if applicable)

docs.title: 🗃️ Off-Chain Logging
docs.text:
• Markdown-based logs stored in:
  • docs/governance/ratified-actions.md
  • docs/treasury/disbursement-log.md
  • docs/security/threat-model.md

  • docs/security/audit-log-policy.md (this file)

  • Optional IPFS hash for external audit reports

docs.title: 🧪 Review & Retention
docs.text:
• Logs are reviewed quarterly by Guardians
  • Immutable logs are retained indefinitely
  • Mutable logs (e.g., merit adjustments) must include version history

docs.title: 🧬 Audit Trail Integrity
docs.text:
• All logs must be:
  • Human-readable
  • Machine-indexable
  • Ethically contextualized

docs.title: 🕊️ Final Note
docs.text: “A protocol that forgets its past cannot protect its future. Let every action be remembered with clarity and conscience.” — MJ Ahmad

docs.title: Nexara Protocol — Guardian Handbook

docs.title: 🧠 Why Guardians Exist
docs.text: In Nexara, code enforces logic—but Guardians enforce conscience. They protect tone, ethics, and the dignity of discourse.

docs.title: 🧾 Core Responsibilities
docs.text: Duty Description 🕊️ Tone Stewardship Ensure respectful, constructive communication 🧬 Persona Oversight Monitor alignment with Persona Consistency Guide 🛡️ Ethical Intervention Flag or respond to violations of the Community Charter 📜 Documentation Maintain logs of interventions and resolutions 🧠 Education Guide new participants in Nexara’s values and norms

docs.title: 🔐 Authority & Limits
docs.text: Action Permitted? Conditions Flag behavior ✅ Yes Must log reason Recommend role review ✅ Yes Requires Maintainer review Revoke role 🚫 No Only governance or Architect may revoke Silence or ban 🚫 No Guardians advise, not punish Emergency escalation ✅ Yes Must notify Architect or Maintainer

docs.title: 🧬 Intervention Protocol

Violation Detected
     │
     ▼

     │
     ▼

     │
     ▼

docs.title: 📘 Reporting Format
docs.text:

  • Role(s) involved

docs.title: 🧠 Behavioral Expectations

docs.title: Nexara Protocol — Incident Response Protocol
docs.text: Maintained by: Sovereign Architect (MJ Ahmad) Purpose: To define how Nexara responds to security breaches, ethical violations, and critical failures

docs.title: 🧠 Response Philosophy
docs.text: In Nexara, response is not just reaction—it is responsibility in motion. Every incident is an opportunity to reinforce trust, not erode it.

docs.title: 🚨 What Qualifies as an Incident?
docs.text: Type Examples 🛡️ Security Breach Smart contract exploit, unauthorized access 🧾 Governance Abuse Vote manipulation, role hijacking 💰 Treasury Misuse Unauthorized fund release, purpose spoofing 🧬 Ethical Violation Harassment, coercion, persona breach 🧠 Merit Fraud Collusion, circular boosting, false attribution

docs.title: 🧾 Reporting Protocol
docs.text:
• Who Can Report: Any participant (anonymous or identified)
  • Where to Report:
  • On-chain via reportIncident() (if supported)
  • Off-chain via encrypted email or Guardian channel
  • What to Include:
  • Description of incident
  • Affected contracts or roles
  • Evidence or transaction hashes
  • Suggested mitigation (optional)

docs.title: 🛠️ Response Flow
docs.text:
Incident Reported
     │
     ▼
Initial Review (Guardian or Maintainer)
     │
     ▼
Severity Assessment (Low / Medium / Critical)
     │
     ├─ Low → Logged + Monitored
     ├─ Medium → Governance Proposal
     └─ Critical → Emergency Override (if needed)
     ▼
Post-Mortem Published + Ratification (if applicable)

docs.title: 🔐 Containment Measures
docs.text:
• Pause affected contracts (if supported)
  • Revoke compromised roles
  • Freeze treasury disbursements
  • Notify community with transparency

docs.title: 🧬 Recovery & Remediation
docs.text:
• Deploy patch or upgrade via proposal
  • Restore affected roles or balances
  • Adjust merit if fraud confirmed
  • Update threat model and audit logs

docs.title: 🕊️ Final Note
docs.text: “A protocol’s strength is not in its perfection, but in its ability to respond with integrity when tested.” — MJ Ahmad

docs.title: Nexara Protocol — Threat Model
docs.text: Maintained by: Sovereign Architect (MJ Ahmad) Purpose: To identify potential risks, attack vectors, and defense strategies across Nexara’s architecture

docs.title: 🧠 Threat Modeling Philosophy
docs.text: Security is not paranoia—it is preparedness with purpose. In Nexara, we defend not just code, but the dignity it protects.

docs.title: 🧱 Threat Surface Overview
docs.text: Layer Components Governance NexaraGov, VoteEngine, ProposalRegistry Merit System MeritEngine, RoleRegistry Treasury NexaraTreasury, TreasuryPolicy Tokenomics NXN Token, Genesis Community Contributor roles, Guardians, Observers

docs.title: 1. 🗳️ Governance Manipulation
docs.text:
• Threat: Sybil attacks, vote buying, proposal flooding
  • Mitigation:
  • Merit-weighted voting
  • Role-based proposal gating
  • Proposal rate limits

docs.title: 2. 💰 Treasury Exploitation
docs.text:
• Threat: Unauthorized fund release, purpose spoofing
  • Mitigation:
  • Purpose-bound disbursement via TreasuryPolicy
  • Role-based access (Treasurer only)
  • On-chain logging + ratification

docs.title: 3. 🧠 Merit Abuse
docs.text:
• Threat: Merit inflation, collusion, circular boosting
  • Mitigation:
  • Maintainer-reviewed merit adjustments
  • Quarterly recalibration
  • Public merit logs

docs.title: 4. 🛠️ Contract Vulnerabilities
docs.text:
• Threat: Reentrancy, overflow, upgrade misuse
  • Mitigation:
  • External audits
  • Immutable Genesis
  • Upgrade via governance only

docs.title: 5. 🧬 Role Hijacking
docs.text:
• Threat: Unauthorized role assignment or revocation
  • Mitigation:
  • RoleRegistry with strict access control
  • Proposal-based role changes
  • Emergency override rollback

docs.title: 6. 🫂 Community Breakdown
docs.text:
• Threat: Harassment, misinformation, tone collapse
  • Mitigation:
  • Community Charter enforcement
  • Guardian intervention
  • Persona Consistency Guide

docs.title: 🔐 Defense-in-Depth Strategy
docs.text:
• ✅ Immutable Genesis
  • ✅ Modular upgrades via vote
  • ✅ Role-based access control
  • ✅ Transparent audit trails
  • ✅ Emergency override (time-bound + ratified)

docs.title: 🕊️ Final Note
docs.text: “A protocol that cannot defend its dignity cannot preserve its sovereignty.” — MJ Ahmad

docs.title: 🧬 Governance-Controlled Expansion
docs.text:
• New purposes may be added via:
  • Governance proposal
  • Ethical alignment review

  • TreasuryPolicy contract update

  • All additions must be:

  • Logged on-chain
  • Referenced in this registry
  • Reviewed quarterly
